website_summaries.verdict: Many dogs prefer the taste of turkey, and this liquid food topper takes that basic flavor profile to another level.
pros: Contains holistic superfoods like pumpkin and ginger
Can be used to rehydrate freeze-dried or raw foods
Works well as a stand-alone liquid treat
cons: Finicky eaters may not find the pumpkin-ginger flavor profile appealing

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my picky dog, but ended up loving it myself. Now we fight over it whenever dinner is served.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Beards

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky puppers.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff. My picky pitbull was refusing her dry food. She has a severe chicken allergy so she had to eat the dry food and there aren't many other quality options. This stuff helped her become 100% more enthusiastic about eating her dinner. She eats every morsel now.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brock

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cats
customer_reviews.text: I know it says DOG food topper, but so do all the other bone broths. My cat really benefits from bb, but this product wasn't good for him. He loved it but it wasn't good for his delicate, old man system (probably because it has apples in it. No cat needs apples, or anything else besides meat.) It's not a bad product but I donated the case to the humane society, and was happy to suck up the $45 for their pups.
customer_reviews.author: LJW

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves the taste!
customer_reviews.text: My little girl was constipated, so I did some reading about it to see what would help. Pumpkin and ginger are recommended. She hasn't been constipated since I started giving her Solid Gold Turkey Broth. It doesn't overcorrect her constipation, and it's very convenient to use. The broth can be added to kibble, drinking water, or given alone,. My dog loves it any way it's served.
customer_reviews.author: Liz McC

customer_reviews.title: Must be tasty!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to stimulate the appetite of a foster dog who needs to gain weight. Well, this must smell and taste good because he eats up the food I give him. Before it was hit or miss whether it would all be consumed. Likely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: 5 Pointers

customer_reviews.title: Great to make into cubes as a treat
customer_reviews.text: I use random bone broths to freeze and use as a treat or in their dinner and this worked well! Chicken was a win for my 3. One thing is I wish it was a little cheaper to buy more at one time..overall there is a lot of broth in the pouch
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help hydrate my dogs in the summer, since we are outdoors a few hours a day. They love this with their kibble.
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: easy, delicious
customer_reviews.text: pour a little over our dogs regular food and she loves it. Tumeric is great for any inflamation, think older dogs and keeping the young healthy. But tasty treat with great health benefits
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Panting Yorkie
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small yorkie and noticed he was panting a lot more than usual!! I sadly had to take him off this topper because it was causing him to be more tired!
customer_reviews.author: Karyanna

customer_reviews.title: Tasty
customer_reviews.text: My dog les this, she can't stop licking the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Champion

customer_reviews.title: Good product - not great packaging.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it, but one of the packs was broken inside the box, which was obviously a waste, but also gross because it started going bad. It should probably be packed a little more carefully.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Good flavor, but not worth the price. It doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this when my dog had tummy trouble. I needed to fast her but didn't want her to get dehydrated. I use it regularly now to moisten her food.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen00

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large breeds!
customer_reviews.text: Bone broth is great for large breed dogs, I started this supplement after my dog started having knee trouble at 2 and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: TS_1982

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I have a finicky chihuahua, that loves it. Excellent service, received it in two days. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: My cane Corsica female is a picky eater. I’ve change foods and supplements several times. Then I tried the bone broth. She does even lift her head from the bowl until it’s gone! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: My dogs didn’t like it and it has a funny smell that doesn’t attract my dogs. I can’t even stand it because it smells like spoiled peppermint if that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Smell
customer_reviews.text: My dog Sebastian took one smell and would not touch so it was waste of money for me
customer_reviews.author: Della S.

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: She didn’t used to like eating kibbles until I poured some of this onto it and now she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor/good value!
customer_reviews.text: It helps make my finicky dog eat and that’s all I could ask for!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo M

customer_reviews.title: Dogs are going nuts
customer_reviews.text: After reading several articles on what a perfect dog's diet should be I bought this broth. Knowing it comes from a solid quality company and that it is human grade makes me happy. Too much dry kibble (even high quality) can not only get boring but also lead to issues with dogs intestines. A raw organic diet is best but since that is a very expensive endeavor, I'm starting with adding broth 2-3 meals per week. My two English Mastiffs are absolutely overjoyed when they smell this! They actually jump around in happiness which says a lot since my older guy is a 155 lb. 8 year old Mastiff!
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful topper for dry kibble
customer_reviews.text: Just like I don't want to eat a bowl of freezing cold cereal in the fall, guessing my pets aren't as excited about chilly kibble either. This bone broth with pumpkin and ginger smells like human food. I warmed it up for just a moment in the microwave prior to dumping it over a bowl of dry kibble, and everybody seemed to enjoy their food with additional relish. It really smells delicious, like something I would make for myself in the fall. I don't know if my pets appreciated the pumpkin and ginger connection to the fall, but certainly nobody was complaining as they dug into their delicious and moist treat.
customer_reviews.author: Gen of North Coast Gardening

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love the beef bone broth!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (corgi/pug mix and beagle) both love about a tablespoon of this broth added to their dry food that has added warm water. My corgi/pug is a little over 10yo and I was having some difficulty with him eating what he needed each day. He happily munches his food with this and warm water added. There was a 30% off deal with the first subscribe and save, so I bought the case of 12 with it and then ended the subscription as you can usually get the individual packets on sale at PetSmart. The packets last a bit over a week for two dogs, getting 1T twice per day added to their food.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: My dog now eats
customer_reviews.text: My picky 13 year old dog black lab has gotten to where no matter what kind of food we get, she won't eat it unless bribed with bacon bits or leftover food. I was excited to find a food topper made for dogs that she LOVES. Eating is no longer a stress induced objective, just pour a few tablespoons over a bowl full of food, stir around to coat the food, and she's happy to dig in. So thankful to be able to put a dog product over her food, rather than leftover human food.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shields

customer_reviews.text: This makes it so much better, my dog does not like dry food that much but giving him too much canned food upsets his stomach. This is a great add on to have him eat the food without first begging for home food. I tried giving him half of the plate with this and the other half without and he only ate the one with so i say it was a win. Of course its not only for food, you can also add it to water to give it a better taste and also increase the nutrition value
customer_reviews.author: Product reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: With two picky pooches, we voted this product is worth it. My dogs prefer soft food, I suppose as any dog may, so when I try to give them kibble, they may go 2 days on a food strike before they eat. This bone broth helps to soften the kibble, but also provides a nice aroma that attracts them to eat it! Not sure if he lavender and chamomile have any effect, however all for incorporating natural anything in their food!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this product. On the one hand my dog was very excited about the package when it come and seemed to enjoy eating it, on the other hand she got sick a few hours after eating it... not sure if I can definitively say if it was from this product, but I do know that I won’t be giving it to her again. Pretty disappointed since I was looking forward to such a great nutritional, healthy item.
customer_reviews.author: The Idahoan

customer_reviews.title: Lavender and Chamomile will Change Your Dog's Life
customer_reviews.text: I'm always intrigued by pet products that add atypical ingredients like lavender and chamomile. Is that what dogs want over buffalo and turkey these days? What millennial came up with this? Sometimes my dog likes a savory meal so I just had a bit of warm water to his bowl. I guess that got boring. So recently, we've been doing pet gravies and he likes those a lot. But now he was so pleased with this bone broth the lavender and chamomile got him addicted to bubble baths and scented candles. Forget Petco now...He wants to got shopping at Pier 1 Imports tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon L. Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: High quality broth for your pup!
customer_reviews.text: Super high in calories, but otherwise awesome! We all love the ingredients in this, and our pup loves the taste more than anything! The big thing to watch is that this is calorically dense, so if you have a lab like us it can lead to pudginess. The pouch lasts forever, and we love it with water and placed in an ice cube tray for a fun summer treat when we are outside for a good amount of time! Anything like this that cools our pup down is a win! Overall really good quality and a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy M

customer_reviews.title: Turkey Bone Broth Dog Food Toppe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food topper for you pup. We give her a scoop of her regular food and top it with this bone broth to turn it into a nice treat! She loves it when we heat up the food just a little too. We use a whole package for her 3 cups of food which, according to the packaging, isn't the proper amount, however she really enjoys it and we've experienced no ill side effects. Only negative is the cost. This is very expensive to sustain, even when only putting 2 tbsp. per cup of food.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Poff

customer_reviews.title: Tasty topper
customer_reviews.text: i use this broth as a topper for dry kibble. I won't pretend that my dog is an especially picky eater, but she really really enjoys having this poured over her food. I do appreciate that it is human grade, but I am not particularly sold on turmeric as a miracle ingredient. I do like the pouches, as they are convenient to store both before eating and in the refrigerator when there are leftovers (something that would never occur if my dog got to control portion size).
customer_reviews.author: SandyCB

customer_reviews.title: Topper for dry food.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been enjoying this product as a topper to her dry food. It is nicely packaged so that you can dispense a bit and save the rest for later. Thus far my dog seems to like the taste of this and eats it up readily. I like giving her bone broth as a nutritional compliment to her regular food as well as to add a bit of healthy variety to her diet. This product is human grade which gives me confidence in the quality of the product although i am not going to be testing it on myself.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperShopping

customer_reviews.title: simple ingredients, made in the USA, good for dogs' tummies
customer_reviews.text: This Solid Gold Bone Broth topper is great for adding some extra tummy-friendly flavor to kibble. The ingredients list is short (just chicken bone broth, carrot, sweet potato, apple, sesame oil, lavender, chamomile). It's great that it's made in the USA, too. Just be careful to only use 2 tablespoons per cup of kibble, "shake well" before each serving, and to refrigerate the rest and use within 7 days of opening the squeeze bags.
customer_reviews.author: datura2002

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Solid Gold is known for their excellent ingredients, this pouch topping is no exception. Healthy grains and proteins. Our pack of rescue mutts is specially trained in Canine Food Tasting & Research. They've been through many hours of intense training. To say they love this food is an understatement. They gobbled it down and begged for more. 16 paws up from my testing crew. Dog Dad approved as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff  🚑 & Jeff's Wife 💅

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the flavor and I love the simple ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure who likes this broth more - me or my dogs. I divided one pouch amongst the 8 dogs over their dry kibble with water instead of the usual canned food. Every single dog licked their bowls dry and didn't leave any evidence that food had been there. I love the simplicity of the ingredients and that it smells exactly like turkey to my nose. I would totally consider adding this broth into our regular feeding routine.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: 12 Packages
customer_reviews.text: First off, you get 12 of these for the price, which works out to be around $3 a pouch. You can use the pouch a few times though and in three different way - top off dry food, add to water or just put in a bowl. It is basically a broth to flavor up foods while adding good stuff. It contains lots of good, natural stuff and no junk to worry about. My chocolate labs have been enjoying it without complaints or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cher Kachelmuss

customer_reviews.title: No go with the dogs
customer_reviews.text: While I am thrilled with the ingredients of the Solid Gold bone broth, I received beef and not turkey. I have a dog allergic to beef. The other 3 dogs didn't care for the bed bone broth. I was shocked. Then again, bone broth tastes different than what you think of as "broth". Not as much flavor. It's very healthy, though. I'm just disappointed I received the wetting kind and the dogs didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: They like it better warmed up
customer_reviews.text: The first time the dogs tried it they were slow to eat, probably due to the lavender scent. It’s not very noticeable for humans but I bet dogs get a good hit. If you warm it up, they scarf it down though, not sure if I want to keep cooking for dogs. It helps them eat their dry dog food when they are picky. I also use it during the summer to add flavor to their water, so they stay hydrated.
customer_reviews.author: Bargn Hntr

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gold Turkey Bone Broth Dog Food Topper
customer_reviews.text: I have used other “bone broth” which looks more like gravy with little chunks of veggies. This one is more like a bouillon. The screw-on lid is great for storing left-overs. The pouches are easy to store. This is the perfect addition for dry food. You’re adding all the nutrients of bone broth and evidentially a lot of taste. Solid Gold makes top quality, trustworthy products.
customer_reviews.author: xkydivr

customer_reviews.title: Great product for picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs is a picky eater and this product stopped her in her tracks. She now is after her food in a big way and no longer turns her nose up and walks away. I am thrilled because I was certainly getting tired of picking up the food she wouldn't eat and haven't to try it again the next night. We will be ordering this on an ongoing basis because it's also good for both my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: FiFi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: My Local Store Ran Out
customer_reviews.text: This broth ran out of my local store and now I have to buy it online which is fine. I'm giving this 5 stars because I give to my dog regularly. The amount totally works for me because you don't want the broth to go bad. 1 pack should last you 4-6 feedings depending on how much you like to add to your dog's food. I like this one the best because it helps my dog stay regular on her high protein diet and she's allergic to chicken and beef so Turkey is all she can have. I love that it has ginger and tumeric in the recipe.
customer_reviews.author: ESK

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved!
customer_reviews.text: This bone broth can be used in a variety of ways--as a treat, food topper, or added to water. This is perfect for my guy, as he needs to drink water after his morning antacid, so all we have to do is mix it in. He loves it as a food topper too. It smells delicious, and has all natural ingredients. Resealable cap. I'm a fan and so is doggo.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: Meh.....
customer_reviews.text: Of course I didn’t taste this because it’s for my dog not that I couldn’t have but he didn’t seem to think it was that great so I didn’t have to and honestly this bag of bone broth is very small, only lasted for maybe 4 to 5 meals so I just don’t think it’s worth buying. I went back to the powdered broth which last for quite a long time and is more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Schmookaloo

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes it as a beverage
customer_reviews.text: My very weird dog won't eat his food if I add this, but he will gladly drink the whole carton from a bowl. So, for him it is just a treat. It does help him keep from possibly being dehydrated during warm weather, but I don't know if that is enough to buy another package. it is the first thing with turmeric that he will eat.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: My dog did eat this eventually. I put it over her food, and she licked her food until there was no broth left. Then, she started eating. I thought maybe it would be good enough to make her finish the bowl. Although she ate a lot, she did not finish. Her expression seems to say that it's good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns kibble into comfort food for dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs sometimes get bored with their everyday Limited Ingredients food. I sometimes switch it up. What this broth does is make their regular every day food be more interesting and more like comfort food. Mr Trouble has been warming this up and that just makes them all crazy happy.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Human grade true broth.  Not a thick sludge.
customer_reviews.text: This is a runny water liquid true bone broth. It does have tumeric in it, which is what makes curry yellow, so it will stain if you spill it. The dogs like it on their kibble. Tumeric is good for controlling inflammation, so it's good for the dog as well as you. This is human grade broth.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Doggo loves it
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find a good 'gravy' for my dog since she is a picky eater, but she laps this up, unfortunately often leaving her healthy dry food at the bottom of her bowl. At least this increases her chances of eating her food, since she loves the flavor. It smells nice too- I love the lavendar.
customer_reviews.author: Serene Night

customer_reviews.title: My dog eats his hard food now!
customer_reviews.text: The description says “ turkey “ however mine is beef and it encourages my dog to eat his hard food. I also use this with his soft food to add extra moisture. My dog seems to like it and he eats whatever I put down when I use this! 🐶❤️ Just 2 tablespoons per cup of dry food and you’re good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Good for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Good quality with a great taste for dogs. Full of beneficial vitamins, minerals and protein for dogs. Lots of ways to use. I freeze them into ice trays, only taking out what I need each day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our doggies love this over there  kibble..
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this healthy for all dogs, its great if you have picky eaters. We have large and small dogs, and when we put this solid gold topper over there dog kibble they can’t eat it up fast enough. All our dogs love this.
customer_reviews.author: Great Cook, Great Cook

customer_reviews.title: My dog won't eat anything that has this on it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves everything. However, I poured this over his favorite food and he won't go near it. I have tried over and over. It may be good stuff, but know, at least my terrier won't eat it. If he won't eat it, there is no benefit!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen  Pomerantz

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients
customer_reviews.text: This bone broth has really healthy ingredients in it. My dog won’t touch it though. He sniffed it and walked away. Maybe he doesn’t like the lavender in it? If you can get your dog to drink this, it is excellent stuff.
customer_reviews.author: 💚TosaTat💚

customer_reviews.title: Dog had no issues
customer_reviews.text: Our pup seemed to like it. I got about 3 feedings out of one pouch. I didn’t notice any changes in his behavior. To be fair.. he’ll eat his own poop sometimes too, so take this with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Shaner

customer_reviews.title: The dog likes it easy to.use
customer_reviews.text: The dog is enthusiastic about this broth , topper and obviously enjoys it. . My only problem.is that it looks and feels exactly like a similar beef broth for people which led to some brief confusion.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Jentoft

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE this broth!
customer_reviews.text: This broth was a huge hit with my dogs. It only takes a little to dress up a dry food so the container takes a few days to use it all. You will be happy with this dog food treat!
customer_reviews.author: Etienne

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: This makes getting those picky eaters to eat without trying every dog food out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: My dog refused to touch his food with this on it. I went out for a day and left this for my dog to eat. When I returned the next day, the food was moldy. I would never use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My beagle doesn't like this
customer_reviews.text: My beagle wouldn't eat this. Usually she will try a new topper. But she smelled it and avoided it allowing her for to get mushy and uneaten for hours. So we won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: Dog devours it
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this stuff! Pour it over his dry food, and he eats every last piece. I have to say, it smells pretty delicious as well.
customer_reviews.author: IAmanonymous

customer_reviews.title: dog food topper
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kibble topper. It’s liquidy to use as a treat on its own. It it’s a nice pour over dry food topper.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging Caused damaged product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, however a couple of the bags were leaking and had to be thrown away. This caused the rest of them to be wet and a sticky mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wood

product_meta.title: Solid Gold - Bone Broth - Human-Grade Bone Broth For Dogs - Natural Collagen - Holistic - Grain-Free - Meal topper and Treat - Great for Picky Eaters
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Turkey| Size:12 CTSolid Gold bone broth meal Toppers provide a nutrient-rich addition to any dog’s meal. Real, human grade turkey bone broth is rich in naturally occurring collagen as well as vitamins and minerals essential for overall wellness. Added pumpkin and ginger provide an aromatic, nutrient-dense and flavorful treat that even the pickiest eaters will love! Solid Gold turkey bone broth is easy to use! Add 2 tablespoons to your dog's food as a tasty topper, use to moisten dry food for dogs with sensitive teeth, add to water for added flavor and to encourage proper hydration, or serve on its own as a tasty treat! .
feature_bullets: Natural, Grain Free & Gluten Free: Holistic
Real, 100% Human Grade: Slow Simmered Turkey Bone Broth With Pumpkin And Antioxidant-Rich Ginger Provides A Nutrient-Dense And Flavorful Addition To Your Dog’S Meal
Naturally Occurring Collagen: Rich In Natural Collagen From Turkey Bones. Collagen Is A Protein Essential For Gut Health And The Strength And Maintenance Of Bones, Joints And Nails
Superfood Ingredients: 100% Human Grade. Solid Gold Bone Broth Is Crafted With Simple, Recognizable Ingredients You And Your Dog Will Love!
